Message.Title: the deal wont be approved
Message.Msg: Dell cant vote his shares. ichan and people allgned with him own 18% and will vote no. Thats 34% that wont vote to approve. so of the remaining 66% of shareholders dell needs a 78% approval rate. If 10% of the remaining shareholders sit out the vote that means dell needs 89% approval of the remaining shares. no way this goes through

Message.Title: About to Skyrocket
Message.Msg: You must research CCUR as soon as possible it is currently just $7.89 per share and has only 8.754mm s/o, a market cap of $69.07mm, cash of $22.37mm, no debt, and an enterprise value of $46.7mm. CCUR's enterprise value is only 0.74X revenues of $63.23mm, 6.55X operating cash flow of $7.13mm, and 8.34X free cash flow of $5.6mm. CCUR's EPS was up 175% last quarter! CCUR just increased its dividend by 100% to $0.48 per share for a HUGE yield of 6.1%. CCUR leads the video on demand (VOD) delivery business with over 2.4mm VOD streams deployed worldwide and 4 of America's 6 largest cable TV operators as clients. CCUR's business is booming as pay-TV operators upgrade their systems to provide new Network DVR, start-over, and look-back services. CCUR is also powering multi-screen services by delivering video to tablets and smartphones for major cable TV operators like Time Warner Cable! Plus, CCUR offers leading content delivery network (CDN) solutions and just signed a huge CDN deal with Virgin Media! The #2 VOD technology vendor SEAC is currently trading for $11.50 and has an enterprise value of $262.4mm or 1.68X revenues of $156.11mm, 15.05X operating cash flow of $17.43mm, and 19.32X free cash flow of $13.58mm. An enterprise value of 1.68X revenues would value CCUR at $14.69. An enterprise value of 15.05X operating cash flow will value CCUR at $14.81. An enterprise value of 19.32X free cash flow will value CCUR at $14.91. In addition, CCUR provides the #1 Big Data Analytics software solution used by cable TV service providers. CCUR tracks the viewing behavior of 35 million cable TV customers and has already processed 15 billion transactions. Big Data Analytics is the #1 hottest tech space on Wall Street. DATA recent went public at $31 and hit a new 52-week high Monday of $63 for a gain of 103%. DATA's enterprise value is currently 25X revenues vs. CCUR's enterprise value of well below 1X revenues! CCUR is about to surpass its 52-week high of $8.45 and explode!

Topic.Title: How to sign up for appraisal?

Message.Msg: The most relevant criteria which appraisers use is recent sale transaction prices. DELL is trading today at $13.34 per share, so that number is as accurate a figure as is possible. Hope this helps.

Your arithmetic is not correct, IMO. 1. Vote count is a function of the votes cast. If Michael Dell does not cast his shares & votes, his number of shares will not be counted either way. 2. For the votes that count, Icahn needs to win the majority. 3. Every time Icahn opens his mouth (like now), the share price goes DOWN. 4. Anybody in the sane mind (like myself, and all other institutions) will vote FOR the deal. Everyone wants the deal to close. Uncertainty is bad for us. 5. Therefore, the vote will go FOR the proposal. 6. Icahn will lose big. Not in $$ but in his reputation. He mis-calculated this time. Michael Dell has more gut that he thought. You cannot win every time.
